com.saic.uicds.core.em.endpoint

Class MapServiceEndpoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.xml.transform.TransformerObjectSupport
      • org.springframework.ws.server.endpoint.AbstractDomPayloadEndpoint
        • com.saic.uicds.core.em.endpoint.MapServiceEndpoint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.saic.uicds.core.infrastructure.util.ServiceNamespaces, org.springframework.ws.server.endpoint.PayloadEndpoint

    @Transactional
public class MapServiceEndpoint
extends org.springframework.ws.server.endpoint.AbstractDomPayloadEndpoint
implements com.saic.uicds.core.infrastructure.util.ServiceNamespaces
    The UICDS Map Service provides a means for interacting with an UICDS core to manage map related resources. The service defines Layer and Map resources and collections of these resources. This model is based on the OGC Web Map Context specification. The operations consist of creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting these resources.

    The Map Service manages UICDS work products of type:

    • "MapViewContext" (OGC ViewContext)
    • "LayerViewContext" (OGC Layer)

    An example MapViewContext work product is shown in the following example. This example shows the default map that is created for each incident. It contains two layers, one is a base map (title: Metacarta) and one is a WMS layer that contains location markers for each work product that is submitted as a "Feature" type through the work product service (title: UICDS Core Map Service). A layer work product is just a single OGC Layer element.

    EPSG 4326 is the recommended SRS for layers that are used withing UICDS. The UICDS core does not access these layers so any type of Service or SRS that is valid for the OGC MapViewContext specification can be added by clients. It is up to the clients that receive the MapViewContext work products to be able to interpret and render the maps and layers.

    As clients add layers to a MapViewContext work product they should set the BoundingBox value to properly cover the extent of features that are renderable in the layers or to the correct bounding box for the incident. 

     <wmc:ViewContext id="MapViewContext-6e8061e3-abb2-417f-9a1e-5074bc549e89" version="1.1.0" xmlns:wmc="http://www.opengis.net/context">
   <wmc:General>
     <wmc:Window height="500" width="600"/>
     <wmc:BoundingBox SRS="EPSG:4326" maxx="-77.430125" maxy="37.53350277777778" minx="-77.430125" miny="37.53350277777778"/>
     <wmc:Title>Default Map for Incident '1acb8113-b6eb-4bdb-9522-b8cf93d9dfaa'</wmc:Title>
     <wmc:KeywordList>
       <wmc:Keyword>Default Map</wmc:Keyword>
       <wmc:Keyword>1acb8113-b6eb-4bdb-9522-b8cf93d9dfaa</wmc:Keyword>
       <wmc:Keyword>UICDS</wmc:Keyword>
     </wmc:KeywordList>
     <wmc:Abstract>Default map for incident with id '1acb8113-b6eb-4bdb-9522-b8cf93d9dfaa'</wmc:Abstract>
   </wmc:General>
   <wmc:LayerList>
     <wmc:Layer hidden="false" queryable="false">
       <wmc:Server service="OGC:WMS" title="Metacarta" version="1.1.0">
         <wmc:OnlineResource xlink:href="http://labs.metacarta.com/wms/vmap0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"/>
       </wmc:Server>
       <wmc:Name>basic</wmc:Name>
       <wmc:Title>Base Map</wmc:Title>
       <wmc:SRS>EPSG:4326</wmc:SRS>
     </wmc:Layer>
     <wmc:Layer hidden="false" queryable="false">
       <wmc:Server service="OGC:WMS" title="UICDS Core Map Service" version="1.1.0">
         <wmc:OnlineResource xlink:href="https://uicds-test3.saic.com/uicds/api/1acb8113-b6eb-4bdb-9522-b8cf93d9dfaa/features?" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"/>
       </wmc:Server>
       <wmc:Name/>
       <wmc:Title>Incident Features</wmc:Title>
       <wmc:SRS>EPSG:4326</wmc:SRS>
     </wmc:Layer>
   </wmc:LayerList>
 </wmc:ViewContext>
    Author:
    Christopher Lakey

      • submitShapefile

        protected Element submitShapefile(Element request,
                      Document document)
                           throws Exception
        Allows the client to create a new Shapefile, Layer, and Feature work products from the supplied shapefile and optionally associated it to an incident. The submitted shapefile must be a zip file that contains .shp, .shx, .prj, dbf, and .avl files and base64 encoded in the ContentData parameter. A UCore Digest should be supplied with a shapefile that contains an Event that describes the shapefile, a Location with a boundary of the shapefile, along with a LocatedAt element to associatd the Event and Location elements.
        Parameters:
        SubmitShapefileRequest -
        Returns:
        SubmitShapefileResponse
        Throws:
        Exception
        See Also:
        Appendix: MapService.xsd
